title: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
summary: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow (February 27, 1807 â€“ March 24, 1882) was an American poet and educator whose works include "Paul Revere's Ride", The Song of Hiawatha, and Evangeline. He was the first American to translate Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy and was one of the fireside poets from New England.
